column5: I caught this smallie last year but i didn't have my scale, how much do you all think it weights? It put up a tremendous fight! thanks
It looks like a 20 incher..I say 3.5 pounds
You need some kind of measurement to estimate weight....at least length.
i would say a little over 3....always a nice fight from these guys....
Between knuckles on the pinky is about an inch, so I'd say 3.1 lbs
This might help you. For comparisons sake, I got this pb LM on Wednesday. It's a 5.2 (oz) beauty. It just annihilated my buzzbait.
I'm assuming the "pb" is short for "probably bait" in this case?
You are such a nut Roy..........

Very nice fish....no doubt it would have been an epic battle.  Likely 3-something...but as others have said...SO hard to tell from a pic.  Length is key...in fact, I've stopped weighing my fish, because the length tells me how "big" they are.  Back when I did weigh them....a girl I was fishing with pulled in a 21 inch bass that was quite chunky and tipped the scales at 4lbs 13oz.  The very next week...same lake....I pulled in a 20.5 inch bass that barely broke the 2lb mark.

Bingo! Best tape measure going. Based on that, your fish is roughly 18 inches long, and probably between 3 and 3.5 pounds. Might be 19 inches, give or take, which would add a little more beef to it and put it squarely in the 3.5 range.    Nice bass! Congrats! It would certainly eat Roy's Personal Bait!
Right now one that size looks good to me lol SBK
I would agree with 3 to 3.5 lber.  nice measuring trick Craig.
Replace the fish with a severed head and you got a killer "Spartacus" going on dude.
If only we could add sound as well as pictures...."Tonight we dine in hell!!"

Haha...thanks guys, my guess was 4 lb but i'll take the 3 - 3.5 lb Roy, that's a nice fish but i think i have you beat in that category. This guy hit my spinnerbait, and managed to hook himself somehow...
